means: 从事文学研究（或写作）的

sentence.Network_en: Her literary criticism focuses on the way great literature suggests ideas.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的文学批评集中关注的是伟大的文学作品表达思想的方式。

sentence.Network_en: Many literary academics simply parrot a set of impressive-sounding phrases.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多文人只是机械地模仿一套听上去令人印象深刻的说法。

sentence.Network_en: By the 1920's, he was lionised by literary London.
sentence.Network_cn: 到了20世纪20年代，他成为伦敦文学界的宠儿。

如果按评判标准分类，则有文学小说(literary fiction)和定格小说(genre fiction)。 文学小说对内容没有要求，对格式的要求就是打破格式.

means.word_mean: 从事写作的,精通文学的,严格正式的

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'relating to the letters of the alphabet'): from Latin litterarius, from littera (see letter)

entry.def: Literary means concerned with or connected with the writing, study, or appreciation of literature.

example.ex: Her literary criticism focuses on the way great literature suggests ideas...
example.tran: 她的文学批评集中关注的是伟大的文学作品表达思想的方式。

example.ex: She's the literary editor of the 'Sunday Review'.
example.tran: 她是《星期天评论》的文学编辑。

entry.tran: （词语、表达方式等）书面的，书卷气的
entry.def: Literary words and expressions are often unusual in some way and are used to create a special effect in a piece of writing such as a poem, speech, or novel.

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or characteristic of literature;
3. appropriate to literature rather than everyday speech or writing;

sentences.sentence: "when trying to impress someone she spoke in an affected literary style"

auth_sentence.content: So who are these jumpers on the literary bondage-wagon?
auth_sentence.res_content: So who are these jumpers on the literary bondage-wagon?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So who are these jumpers on the literary bondage-wagon?

auth_sentence.content: But most of all she encouraged his literary dreams.
auth_sentence.res_content: But most of all she encouraged his literary dreams.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But most of all she encouraged his literary dreams.

auth_sentence.content: The vice of the literary mind is excessive subtlety.
auth_sentence.res_content: The vice of the literary mind is excessive subtlety.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The vice of the literary mind is excessive subtlety.

stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+al……的→adj.文字[上]的;字面的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+ary……的→adj.文学上的,文学的;精通文学的,从事写作的
il不+literacy[n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力]→没有文化→文盲

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有文化,有教养,有读写能力
stems_affixes.word_buile: liter文字,字母+acy性质,状态→n.有文化,有教养,有读写能力
liter文字,字母+ati表复数→文字人→文人学者
obliterate[v.涂掉,擦掉]+ion表名词→n.涂去, 删除
ob倒,去掉+liter文字,字母+ate表动词→去掉文字→擦掉

Sentence.sentence: But they have a powerful hold on many people nonetheless, a hold extending far beyond their literary content.
For example, in 1909 anyone who wanted to make a single copy of a literary work for personal use had to do so by hand.

In very literary styles, the newly resurfaced manuscripts offered a rich stock of African-American culture,recreating among other things the early days of slavery and the importance of religion to the slaves.
Literary works calling for the abolition of slavery

sentences.en: Your style is a bit too literary.
sentences.cn: 你的文笔书卷气重了一点。

jushi.english: The letter is written in literary style.
jushi.chinese: 这封信是以文言文体写成的。

jushi.english: Either an author or a man interested in literature is named a literary man.
jushi.chinese: 一个作者或一个对文学感兴趣的人被称作文人。

jushi.english: I like reading the textbook of literary criticism by contemporary authors.
jushi.chinese: 我喜欢读由当代作家写的文学评论文集。
